message.content:
Sure, I can help you with that! However, to provide an accurate solution, I would need more information about the DataFrame and what specific columns you want to compare. Could you please specify? 

Here's a general example of how you might create such a plot using matplotlib:
```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Assuming df is your DataFrame and 'column1' & 'column2' are the columns to compare
df = pd.read_csv('yourfile.csv')# replace with your file path if necessary
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))

plt.subplot(211)
df['column1'].hist()
plt.title("Distribution of 'column1'")

plt.subplot(212)
df['column2'].hist()
plt.title("Distribution of 'column2'")

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```
This code will create a histogram for each column in your DataFrame, with the titles indicating what is being compared. Adjust the `figsize` parameter to change the size of the plot and adjust the subplot layout as needed. 

Please provide more details about your dataframe and columns so I can give you a specific solution tailored to your needs.
